avalancheActivity.comment:
Further increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense.
The new snow is bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. The new snow can be released easily or naturally in all aspects and generally above the tree line. Many medium-sized and large natural avalanches are possible.
The current avalanche situation calls for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Further increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 50 to 70 cm of snow will fall until the evening above approximately 1500 m. The new snow will be deposited on soft layers in all aspects above approximately 1800 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is largely stable; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Gradual increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.
The new snow is bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. The new snow can be released easily or naturally in all aspects and generally above the tree line. Many medium-sized and large natural avalanches are possible.
The current avalanche situation calls for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 40 to 70 cm of snow will fall until midday above approximately 1500 m. The new snow is lying on soft layers in all aspects above approximately 1800 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is favourably layered; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind.
The new snow is bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. The new snow can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant in all aspects and generally above the tree line. Many medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible.
The current avalanche situation calls for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 50 cm of snow will fall until the afternoon above approximately 1500 m. The new snow is lying on soft layers in all aspects above approximately 1800 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is favourably layered; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind. The prevalence of avalanche prone locations and likelihood of triggering will increase in the afternoon. In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, above the tree line: The new snow can be released easily or naturally in all aspects and generally above the tree line.
Many small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase in the afternoon.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 15 to 30 cm of snow will fall until the afternoon above approximately 1500 m. The new snow will be deposited on a crust in particular on east to south to west facing aspects.
Towards its base, the snowpack is largely stable; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow. The new snow remains for the foreseeable future prone to triggering in all aspects and generally above the tree line.
